column1: sfighter; Standard Fighter; fighter; vulcan; tcomp;; Stock close combat fighter. Cheap and effective in taking out other Fighters and poorly armored Frigates.
interceptor; Interceptor; fighter; predator; larmor;; Fast Interceptor
column2: specifically designed to hunt down and obliterate other Fighters. Low Armor penetration capabilities lower its effectiveness in all other fields.
vulcan; tcomp;; Modified fighter with a strong weapon layout. Mainly useful as anti-Frigate solution.
jaeger; hardsys;; Missile Loadout for the Heavy fighter. Decent allround stats make this type of fighter a viable solution for most fights.
cloak;; The stock fleet bomber. The 'Nutracker' plasma bomb is a decent option against all heavily armored targets.

column3: more-allrounder variant of the standard bomber. The particle lance has extreme armor piercing capabilities while still providing reasonable tracking

column4: tcomp;; Fast and precise loadout for the frigate hull. Ideal for surgical strikes against poorly defended fleets or as anti fighter screen.
cloak;; Making use of the incredible armor penetration capabilities of the 'Sadist'
column5: this Frigate is an ideal support ship to finish off damaged capital ships
column6: thereby freeing the resources of its larger fleet companions.
fshield;; Stock escort ship. Suited ideally for defense against swarms of smaller ships.
tcomp;; Allround destroyer for limited combat operations in unknown territory. Fitted with reasonable defenses against fighters as well as highly armor piercing ordnance for anti-capital warfare.

column1: lfcrui; Light Fleet Cruiser; lcruiser; blaze
column8: fitted for a multitude of roles. Meant as mainstay of a small fleet
column9: not as suitable (though still viable) for larger fleet operations.

column1: sacruiser; Support Artillery Cruiser; acruiser; doorkeeper; tcomp
column2: rbulk;; Brittle Cruiser providing hefty artillery Support. Do not use without escort.

column1: cbcruiser; Combat Battle Cruiser; bcruiser; spike
column9: suitable for limited engagement. Best used as part of a fast response fleet.

column1: stbcruiser; Stun Battle Cruiser; bcruiser; current
column8: aburn;; Battlecruiser specifically designed to shut down all electronics on small to medium targets. One of these cruisers is able to keep several enemies at bay
column9: though he likely will not be the one to land the finishing blow.

column1: fshcruiser; Fire Support Heavy Cruiser; hcruiser; slaughter
column4: fshield; sfighter: 5; The Fire Support type Heavy Cruiser provides fire support on first contact as well as during battle
column5: while his fighter wing provides some cover to all fleet members.

column12: aburn;; Battleship designed for brutal front line engagement. With a weapon loadout suitable to crush everything up to its own weight class
column13: this ship dominates every mid-sized engagement.

column12: harmor;; Specialized Battleship to keep the small fry at bay. Any fighter will run in fear (if it is still able to) when this monstrosity unleashes volley after volley of highly accurate and deadly ordnance.

column1: fsdnought; Fire Support Dreadnought; dnought; avalanche
column6: tcomp;; Dreadnought for heavy fire support. Rips apart everything thats sluggish or slow enough to be hit by its superheavy auto cannons.

column7: meant to besiege planets and vaporize all large scale opponents.

column9: pbomb: 20; Carrier with a bit of everything for every situation in its hangar bays.

column16: scap;; Titan made to besiege planets and fortresses. Its signature 'Apocalypse' Giga Laser
column18: renders any opposition consisting of battleships and the like almost meaningless.

column1: pdtitan; Point Defense Titan; titan; sunfire
column16: tcomp;; Titan made to deal with all manners of pesky fighter craft. Utterly crushes all minor craft
column17: even if thrown at it in force.
